title: Russian propaganda demystified: where have you been 8 years?
description:
Everyone knows that propaganda is the basis of russian federation. Sometimes it sounds funnier than memes. Sometimes it seems like people who invent that bullshit is some screenwriters suckers who failed their careers on Netflix.
But unfortunately, russian propaganda can have damaging consequences. In our case, it's war. 
Since the war broke out in Ukraine, the most popular question of russian propaganda was: "Where have you been for 8 years?"
This is far too cynical, as we have been defending our country from russia for 8 years already! In this video, I would like to explain the meaning of this stupid question and answer it.

–ü—Ä–æ–¥–æ–ª–∂–∞–µ–º –ø–æ–≥—Ä—É–∂–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ JavaScript 2020 –∏ —Å–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º–∏–º—Å—è —Å–æ —Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä–æ–π –∏ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞–º–∏ —Å–∏–Ω—Ç–∞–∫—Å–∏—Å–∞ —è–∑—ã–∫–∞. –ü—Ä–æ—â–µ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è —Å –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–∞–º–∏ –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏—è JS –∫–æ–¥–∞. –ü—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∞ –Ω–∞ JavaScript ‚Äì —ç—Ç–æ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ü–∏–π (statements). –ò–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ü–∏—è ‚Äì —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–µ–∫–∞—è –∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω—á–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è –∑–∞–ø–∏—Å—å, –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—É—é –º—ã –æ—Ç–¥–∞–µ–º –Ω–∞ –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ. –ü—Ä–∏ –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ü–∏–π, –∏—Ö –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—è—Ç–æ —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª—è—Ç—å –º–µ–∂–¥—É —Å–æ–±–æ–π —Ç–æ—á–∫–æ–π —Å –∑–∞–ø—è—Ç–æ–π. –ü—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º –≤ JavaScript –¥–æ–ø—É—Å–∫–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –Ω–µ —Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å —Ç–æ—á–∫—É —Å –∑–∞–ø—è—Ç–æ–π –≤ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–µ –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ü–∏–∏, –µ—Å–ª–∏ —Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–∞—è –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ü–∏—è –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞—Ç—å—Å—è —Å –Ω–æ–≤–æ–π —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∫–∏. –ù–æ —ç—Ç–æ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–µ—Ç –Ω–µ –≤–æ –≤—Å–µ —Å–ª—É—á–∞—è—Ö. –ò–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ü–∏–∏ JavaScript –º–æ–≥—É—Ç —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è—Ç—å –∏–∑: –∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–∏–π, –æ–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≤, –≤—ã—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏–π, –∫–ª—é—á–µ–≤—ã—Ö —Å–ª–æ–≤ –∏ –∫–æ–º–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ä–∏–µ–≤. –î–ª—è –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–∞ —ç—Ç–∏—Ö —á–∞—Å—Ç–µ–π –∑–∞–ø–ª–∞–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω —Å–≤–æ–π –æ—Ç–¥–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –≤—ã–ø—É—Å–∫. –°–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è –º—ã —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —Å–ª–µ–≥–∫–∞ –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º–∏–º—Å—è —Å –Ω–∏–º–∏. –°—Ç—Ä–æ–≥–∏–π —Ä–µ–∂–∏–º ‚Äî "use strict". –ö–æ–≥–¥–∞ –ø–æ—è–≤–∏–ª—Å—è ECMAScript 5 (ES5). –°—Ç–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ä—Ç –æ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º —è –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–ª –≤ –ø—Ä–æ—à–ª–æ–º —É—Ä–æ–∫–µ. –í JS –ø–æ—è–≤–∏–ª–∏—Å—å –Ω–æ–≤—ã–µ –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –∏ –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–∏–ª–∏—Å—å –Ω–µ–∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –∏–∑ —Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â–∏—Ö. –ß—Ç–æ–±—ã —É—Å—Ç–∞—Ä–µ–≤—à–∏–π –∫–æ–¥ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–ª, –∫–∞–∫ –∏ —Ä–∞–Ω—å—à–µ, –ø–æ —É–º–æ–ª—á–∞–Ω–∏—é –ø–æ–¥–æ–±–Ω—ã–µ –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω—è—é—Ç—Å—è. –ü–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É –Ω–∞–º –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ —è–≤–Ω–æ –∏—Ö –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å —Å –ø–æ–º–æ—â—å—é —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –∑–∞–ø–∏—Å–∏: "use strict".

description:

–ü–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π –≤–∏–¥ - –∏–∫–æ–Ω–∫–∏. –ö–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–æ - —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–µ–±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—ã–µ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç—É—Ä–Ω—ã–µ –∫–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–Ω–∫–∏, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –≤—Å—è—á–µ—Å–∫–∏ —É–ª—É—á—à–∞—é—Ç –≤–æ—Å–ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–∏–µ –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–∏. –ò–º–∏ –º–æ–≥—É—Ç —Å–æ–ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ–∂–¥–∞—Ç—å—Å—è —Ç–µ–∫—Å—Ç–æ–≤—ã–µ –Ω–∞–¥–ø–∏—Å–∏ –∏ –∑–∞–≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–∫–∏, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ —ç–ª–µ–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏ –Ω–∞–≤–∏–≥–∞—Ü–∏–∏. –¢—É—Ç –∏–¥–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ –ø–æ–¥–æ–π–¥–µ—Ç –∫–∞–∫ —Ä–∞–∑ –≤–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–Ω—ã–π —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç –≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–∫–∏. 
–í—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π –≤–∏–¥ - —ç—Ç–æ —Ñ–æ–Ω–æ–≤—ã–µ –∏–∑–æ–±—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏ —ç–ª–µ–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã –¥–∏–∑–∞–π–Ω–∞ –≤–µ–± - –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è. –û–Ω–∏ –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å —á–∞—Å—Ç–∏—á–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–æ–∑—Ä–∞—á–Ω—ã–º–∏ –∏ –¥–∞–∂–µ —Å–æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞—Ç—å –∞–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ü–∏—é. –¢—É—Ç –≤ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω–æ–º –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–µ—Ç—Å—è —Ä–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–≤—ã–π —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç –≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–∫–∞ –∏ –∏–Ω–æ–≥–¥–∞ –≤–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–Ω—ã–π.
–ù—É –∏ —Ç—Ä–µ—Ç–∏–π –≤–∏–¥ - —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–µ–ø–æ—Å—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –∏–∑–æ–±—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç–Ω–æ–π —á–∞—Å—Ç–∏ —Å–∞–π—Ç–∞, —Ç–æ –µ—Å—Ç—å –∫–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–Ω–∫–∏ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥—è—Ç—Å—è –≤ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å—è—Ö, —Ä–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã—Ö —Ñ–æ—Ç–æ –≥–∞–ª–µ—Ä–µ—è—Ö —Å–ª–∞–π–¥–µ—Ä–∞—Ö –∏ —Ç–∞–∫ –¥–∞–ª–µ–µ. –¢—É—Ç —É –Ω–∞—Å —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —Ä–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–≤—ã–µ –∏–∑–æ–±—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è.

title: Network of The Witcher | Relationship Extraction & Network Analysis with Spacy & NetworkX
description:
üîë GitHub repo for this project: https://github.com/thu-vu92/the_witcher_network
üìπ First episode of this series: https://youtu.be/RuNolAh_4bU
üôá‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Graph Analytics for Big Data(Coursera): https://imp.i384100.net/oeWP1O
ü§ì Join my Discord server: https://discord.gg/SK7ZC5XhcS

Hey data nerds üëã, in this video we made an attempt to extract relationships between The Witcher's characters from the books. We also did some graph analyses (centrality measures and community detection) and visualization using NetworkX and Pyvis. The analyses are still quite preliminary and I might have glossed over some details, but hopefully, this is a bit interesting and you learned something from it ü§ì. This is the second project in the Witcher project series where we will analyze the relationships between characters. The next episode of this series will be all about network graph visualization üòÅ. I hope you enjoyed this video and any questions and thoughts are welcome! Thank you for watching üôåüèΩ

description:

üëâMore about Stackbit: https://www.stackbit.com/

Portfolio website is great for showing your data science projects with others, and also showing who you are as a person :). Good news is that you can build a blog site very quickly and easily thanks to several tools available nowadays. In this video, I'm showing you how to use Stackbit. Finally, we will also connect our website with a custom domain if you own one (highly recommend!). Our website will be hosted on Netlify for free (hopefully forever!). title: Data Science Career, Work-life Balance, Study: 15K Sub Q&A
description:
üîó Teach yourself CS (including Data structures & Algos): https://teachyourselfcs.com/

üîë TIMESTAMPS
(I'm very sorry if I missed any of your questions! I hope I will be able to answer them in another video or another time üòâ)
================================
0:00 - Thank you üôåüèΩ
0:40 - What is your belief on work-life balance?
2:08 - Is data analytics a stressful lifestyle; meaning, are you constantly having to work overtime?
2:47 - How often of each skillset (tableau, python, etc.) would you say you spend the most on?
3:13 - How can we make transition to making portfolio projects and most importantly showcase them? How many projects are optimal and or minimum for a portfolio?
4:00 - Tell us about your time in Vietnam! üáªüá≥ South or North?  What made you want to learn English and move abroad. How come you chose The Netherlands?
4:50 - I am also planning on taking another Bachelor's. What do you think would be beneficial if I want to go to the IT Business Analyst track, to study CS or straight up go to a Bachelor's in Data Science?
5:39 - I am a physicist with Ph.D., strong knowledge in statistics and experience in scientific programming in R, but without experience in the industry. Should I try a position as a data scientist at the entry level or a higher level?
6:39 - Would you like to share your experience in studying abroad? 
8:12 - How do you approach dealing with Math, specifically those that are technical?
8:52 - At what point can one use the Data Scientist/ Data Science consultant title?
9:36 - Pros and cons of working in data analytics at a consulting firm vs industry
10:25 - It would be really great for us if you start tutorial on advanced Data Science concepts.
11:07 - How old are you? (It's ok if you don't want to answer this üòÖ)
11:26 - How much time it took you to become an independent professional on the data analytics field
11:54 - How much mathematics do we need to learn for data analytics and machine learning.
12:47 - How long do you think it will take for one to start learning data analytics(beginner level) and be ready to apply for jobs?
13:34 - How did you handle impostor syndrome as a junior data analyst? And what would you advise?
14:50 - Could you address how you network to find a job? I understand that I should connect on linked and join career fair, but I don‚Äôt know how should i talk to network with them?
15:15 - What's your preferred development environment to build an end-to-end data science project?.
15:38 - Interview process of data analyst?
15:55 - Will there be the case for mixing data analyst and data scientist job?
16:26 - How do you manage to work at a faang company and still have time for YouTube and personal life??
17:06 - How much data structure and algorithm is needed for better data science career?
18:18 - What are some books that helped you in your career and in your life?

title: How I come up with Data Project IDEAS üí°
description:
Hello, data junkies! In today's video, I will talk about how I come up with personal data projects to develop different data skills. I feel like this topic is not talked about often enough. For those of you who are new to data science and still exploring and learning new things, I think personal projects are a fantastic way to learn new skills at your own pace and develop an interesting data portfolio to prepare you for a data science role. I'm curious which projects you will come up with for yourself! Let me know in the comment below. Thank you for watching! üëã

description:

Hello everyone! In today's video, I'll be talking about the data science job landscape in Amsterdam, the Netherlands: salaries of different data science jobs, benefits, and the Dutch working culture. I have lived and worked in the Netherlands for more than 6 years. I took a Master's in Amsterdam, graduated, got an internship, and fast forward I have had 2 full-time data science jobs since. This video is requested by one of my subscribers, and I had a lot of fun making it! Hope you enjoyed this video and thank you for watching! üëã

What's up, everyone! In today's video, I'll talk about some of the skills that online data science/ data analytics courses often don't teach you. After a few years of being in the field, I feel like there are a lot of useful skills and techniques that are often covered so briefly or completely overlooked by the recently introduced online certificates. With this video, I hope to introduce you to some of the blind spots and missing pieces that could be helpful to you in your journey of becoming a data analyst or entry-level data scientist. Hi everyone! In this video, I‚Äôm talking about some insights I‚Äôve learned to help you decide if a data science job is worth taking. There are a lot of considerations when it comes to taking a job, and I wanted to cover some of the aspects that I think are really crucial in this decision, for example working culture, teams, training and development opportunities, big vs. small companies, in-house vs. consulting etc. I hope this video is helpful for you in your process of looking for a new data science opportunity! title: M1 Chip is as FAST as M1 Max!!! ü§Ø  (13" Mac Air Vs. 14" Mac Pro) #shorts
description:
How I Learned Python  üëâüèº https://lukeb.co/PythonBasicsDataCamp
üõë NOTE: Under multi-threading testing conditions the M1 Max is of course faster than the M1.  BUT as a data analyst, I more frequently run single-threaded code; therefore, the benefits of paying +$1K for these minimum gains are not worth the money.  I've also tested many other multi-threaded applications for data analysts and don't notice much of a performance increase.  Because of this, I recommend the M1 Macbook Air for those starting in data science. 

üåü OTHER NOTE: I'm not actually selling my M1 Max... sorry. ü§£.  This is a great computer if you are working with tools outside of the data science realm (like video editing in my case).

üêç Technical details of test üëâüèº A 100,000 iterating loop test requiring list comprehension for paragraphs processed with NLP.  Test was performed multiple times on these computers to verify results.

üíª Computers:
2020 13" M1 Macbook Air - 8GBs Memory
2021 14" M1 Max Macbook Pro - 64GBs Memory

title: M1 Max/Pro vs M1 Macbook for Data Science.... should you?!?
description:
Parallels 14-day Free Trial üëâüèº https://lukeb.co/ParallelsFreeTrial

How does the new M1 chip from Apple compare to the M1 Max and Pro chips?  I set out to test the M1 chip on my 13" Macbook Pro against an M1 Max chip on my 14" Macbook Pro.  For the tests, I compared the use of popular data science applications such as: Python, R, Excel, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Parallels (Virtual Machines), Docker (Containers), SQL, and the Terminal (Command Line).

How To Install Windows 11:
====================================
1. Install Parallels üëâüèº¬†https://lukeb.co/ParallelsFreeTrial
2. Sign-up Windows Insider Program üëâüèº¬†https://insider.windows.com/en-us/register
3. Download Windows 11 for ARM64 üëâüèº  https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/software-download/windowsinsiderpreviewARM64
4. Double-click on '.VHDX' file to Install Windows 11 in Parallels

description:

https://lukeb.co/WebScrapingPython

What up, Data Nerds!  In part 2 of my portfolio project series, I'm walking you through how I selected a dataset for my project of building a dashboard to provide insights on becoming a data analyst. title: How to get Data Analytics side jobs - NEW LinkedIn Feature  #shorts
description:
LinkedIn's Service Marketplace was recently launched and allows you to list your services and then be contacted for freelance work from others on the platform!

‚úçüèº To apply: 
1. In a browser, go here üëâüèº https://www.linkedin.com/services
2. Under 'Are you a provider?', click "Get Started"
3. This will navigate you to Linkedin.com (or LinkedIn app if on mobile) to then fill out the form

NOTE: The LinkedIn mobile app doesn't have a way to access this feature to sign up; you have to follow the steps above to complete it.

title: BEST JOBS in Data Science
description:
Google Data Analytics Certificate (Roberto & Luke's Pick) üëâüèº  https://lukeb.co/GoogleCert
Machine Learning by Andrew Ng (Mo's Top Pick) üëâüèº https://lukeb.co/MLandrewNg
Deep Learning Specialization (Ruchi's Top Pick) üëâüèº https://lukeb.co/DeepLearningAndrewNg
Mindshift: How to Learn (Bernard's Top Pick) üëâüèº https://lukeb.co/LearningHowToLearn

What's up, Data Nerds! I was interested to learn more about what others are doing in some of the top jobs in data science.  Specifically, I talk with some of my friends about the most common roles in this field of: Data Analyst, Data Scientist, Data Engineer, Machine Learning (ML) Engineer, and Data Science Manager.  They share details about what they do day-to-day in their job and also how they recommend getting these types of jobs!

Roberto's Portfolio üëâüèº https://roberto121c.github.io/Roberto_Calzadilla_Projects/

description:
How I learned GIT üëâüèº  https://lukeb.co/GitDataCamp

In this video, we cover one of my favorite tools to use as a data analyst: Git (with GitHub).  Git is a version control system that allows you to track your changes when working on your project.  GitHub is an online platform that allows you to host your files and also the central git repository.  As a data analyst, this is an excellent tool to know not only to be able to collaborate on teams but also to share your portfolio with others.

title: Python Project  - Using an API to count my bike jumps!
description:
Python for Everybody üëâüèº https://lukeb.co/PythonForEverybody
(NOTES: Course price is $49 USD per month.  25% discount ended 12-May-2021.)

In this video, we go through how I used my Garmin Fenix 6 fitness watch's GPS data to calculate how many jumps I am hitting every day on my mountain bike.  I use the Strava app to track all of my fitness data from my watch.  Because of this, I can access Strava's API with Python to pull my fitness data on where I have gone for the day.  From there I use Python to combine the number of jumps that are on each trail with my Strava data to then visualize the number of jumps I hit.

Github Repo w/ üêç code üëâüèºhttps://github.com/lukebarousse/MountainBikeStats

Article with details on the Strava API üëâüèº  https://towardsdatascience.com/using-the-strava-api-and-pandas-to-explore-your-activity-data-d94901d9bfde

title: Mac Vs PC - BEST for Data Science
description:

title: Data Science shortcuts for Mac
description:
Parallels 14-day Free Trial üëâüèº https://lukeb.co/ParallelsFreeTrial

We waste 8 workdays a year moving our hands between our keyboard and mouse/trackpad.  In this, I go over the shortcuts that I use on daily basis for my job as a data analyst with my Mac.  I show how to select, navigate, and organize apps in order to maximize productivity.

Rectangle üëâüèº https://rectangleapp.com/

Alfred üëâüèº https://apps.apple.com/us/app/alfred/id405843582?mt=12

Create Mac Shortcuts üëâüèº https://support.apple.com/en-au/guide/mac-help/mchlp2271/11.0/mac/11.0

Navigating Apps
---
CMD + Space - Spotlight Search
CMD + (SHIFT +) Tab - Navigate Apps
CMD + M - Minimize App
CMD + W - Stop App (Still running in background)
CMD + Q - Quit App (No longer running)
OPT + CMD + Space - Launch Finder
CMD + OPT + Esc - Force Quit App
  
Organizing Apps
---
CTRL + Arrow - Navigate Desktops
(Rectangle Shortcuts Only)
CTRL + Option + Enter - Maximize Window
CTRL + Option + Arrow - Position Window

Browser Navigation
---
CMD + T - New Tab
CMD + W - Close Tab
CMD + L - Select Search Bar 
CMD + Enter - Duplicates Tab
CMD + Arrow - Back (Forward) Page
CMD + OPTION + Arrow - Cycle Tabs
 
Random Shortcuts
---
CMD + C  - Copy
CMD + X - Cut
CMD + V - Paste
CMD + SHIFT + 4 - Screenshot
OPT + CMD + Space Bar - Emoji Menu Bar

title: Windows on the M1 Mac - What are your options?
description:
Parallels 14-day Free Trial üëâüèº https://lukeb.co/ParallelsFreeTrial

VIDEO UPDATE: Parallels is now fully developed for the M1 Mac (i.e. Free Tech Preview is no longer available).  In the US it's $80 USD for this application.  

The switch from Intel (x86 architecture) to M1 Chips (ARM architecture) has made it more difficult to access Windows via your M1 Mac.  In this I go over 4 popular options to access Windows on your machine: Dual Boot (with Boot Camp Assistant), Virtual Machines (with Parallels), Windows Compatibility Layer (with Crossover), and Desktop as a Service (with Amazon Workspaces)

title: Python Functions for Data Science / Data Analysis - P.5
description:
Python Fundamentals Course (DataCamp) üëâüèº https://lukeb.co/PythonBasicsDataCamp
Data Analyst Track w/ Python (DataCamp) üëâüèº https://lukeb.co/PythonAnalystDataCamp
(My recommended courses that I took to learn Python!)

This video provides an overview of how data scientists and data analysts frequently use function.  We start with understanding the use case for functions and then take a look at Python's built-in functions.  We then spend the majority of the time covering how to build functions and more complex aspects of functions, like the unpacking operator (*, **).  Finally, we apply what we learn to build a function that counts the lines of specified actors from 'The Office' CSV dataset.

title: Python List Comprehension for Data Science / Data Analysis - P.4
description:
Python Fundamentals Course (DataCamp) üëâüèº https://lukeb.co/PythonBasicsDataCamp
Data Analyst Track w/ Python (DataCamp) üëâüèº https://lukeb.co/PythonAnalystDataCamp
(My recommended courses that I took to learn Python!)

This video provides an overview of List, Set, Tuple, & Dictionary Comprehension frequently used by Data Analysts and Data Scientists.  We cover how to build multiple examples for data analysis purposes including conditional statements (i.e. if statements).  Finally, we combine what we learned to use set comprehension to provide a list of seasons that an inputted actor is a part of for the TV show 'The Office.'

Playlist (Course) Material üëâüèº https://github.com/lukebarousse/Python_Intro

00:00 Intro
01:10 List Comprehension: Comparing For Loops

title: Python For & While Loops for Data Science / Data Analysis - P.3
description:

(My recommended courses that I took to learn Python!)

This video provides and overview of how loops (for and while) are used by data scientist and data analysts.  In this tutorial we take time to cover for and while loops and how they are used with different built in functions such as: range(), enumerate(), & .items().  Additionally, we cover loop control statements: break, continue, pass.  Finally, we combine what we learned to analyze the script from the popular TV show "The Office" to find lines that contain: That's what she said.

description:

Additionally, we cover operators used within if statements such as: Comparison (==, !=), Logical (and, or, not), Identity (is), and Membership (in).  At the end we build a simple chatbot with what we have learned, to provide feedback on characters from 'The Office'.

Also, if curious, here is more on operator precedence üëâüèº https://docs.python.org/3/reference/expressions.html#operator-precedence

title: Calculated Fields in Tableau (Formulas & IF Statements) - Tableau Tutorial P.6
description:
Tableau Fundamentals (DataCamp) üëâüèº https://lukeb.co/TableauDataCamp
(My recommended course that I took to learn Tableau!)

Part 6 of this tutorial covers how to create calculated fields in Tableau.  We first go over a simple example and then onto a more complex example using a logical function.

00:00 Intro

caption: false

title: eAid ‚Äî government payments in Diia app
description: Government material assistance in a few clicks, right in Diia app. Ministry of Digital Transformation has completely changed the approach of social services. This is the largest online social service in the history of Ukraine. We managed to simplify and speed up the process for people as much as possible. One virtual card for all state payments in the future.

description: Diia. Digital Signature is a secure signature on your smartphone. Blink to sign documents online. Afterwards, the image of your face is verified with the photo in the state register. Using this digital signature people are able to sign contracts and open bank accounts online. Diia app saves all signing history.

description:

title: Introducing e-Residency Ukraine üöÄ
description:
What is it like to start and run your own business in Ukraine with a few clicks, without being physically present there? Check out the opportunities of Ukrainian e-residency in our introductory video ü§©.

E-residency is a special status, granted by the Ukrainian government, providing foreign freelancers engaged in the creative sector (primarily IT specialists) with the opportunity to stand out among others and run a location-independent business in Ukraine. They will be able to become a private entrepreneur, run their official business under Ukrainian laws paperlessly and use online banking services.

Learn more about e-residency and pre-register here: https://e-resident.diia.gov.ua
caption: true
